attributes.action: Pay attention when millions sign a petition
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The petition against road pricing was signed by over two million people. That, even to a politician, should read as 'perhaps this idea is not a good one.'
But the government clearly has not responded to public opinion by announcing trials of road pricing around the UK.
What is the point of this epetition system if you are not going to allow the millions signing to affect your final decision? Remember, we are the electorate.
We decide whether you have a job or not, and this government is not far from it's collective P45.
